title: ACME Space plans test run for balloon-launched space factory next year
summary:
LONDON – London-headquartered ACME Space has unveiled plans to begin hardware tests of its balloon-launched orbital manufacturing vehicle Hyperion next year and hopes to commence commercial operations in 2027.  The Hyperion Orbital Factory Vehicle (OFV) is designed to carry up to 200 kilograms to low Earth orbit (LEO), using a hydrogen-filled balloon to overcome the […]
The post ACME Space plans test run for balloon-launched space factory next year appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Astronaut Chris Williams, Crewmates Arrive at Space Station
summary: NASA astronaut Chris Williams, accompanied by Roscosmos cosmonauts Sergey Kud-Sverchkov and Sergei Mikaev, safely arrived at the International Space Station on Thursday, expanding the orbiting laboratory’s crew to 10 for the next two weeks. The trio launched aboard the Soyuz MS-28 spacecraft at 4:27 a.m. EST (2:27 p.m. Baikonur time) from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in […]

title: NASA astronaut, two cosmonauts take Thanksgiving Day ride to space station
summary: Astronomer-turned-medical physicist and now NASA astronaut Chris Williams joined two Russian cosmonauts aboard a Soyuz ferry ship Thursday for a Thanksgiving Day flight to the International Space Station, kicking off a planned eight-month stay in orbit.

title: China set for first orbital launch and landing attempt this weekend with commercial Zhuque-3 rocket
summary:
HELSINKI — Chinese commercial launch firm Landspace is preparing to attempt the country’s first orbital launch and booster landing this weekend with its Zhuque-3 rocket. Airspace closure notices issued under the Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC) indicate a launch attempt from the vicinity of Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center between around 11:00 p.m. Eastern Nov. […]

title: ESA and Norway announce plans for an Arctic Space Centre
summary:
ESA and Norway have signed a letter of intent and formed a joint working group to assess the feasibility of a new ESA Arctic Space Centre.
The post ESA and Norway announce plans for an Arctic Space Centre appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Inaugural Space Rider Flight to Occur in 2028
summary:
The European Space Agency has announced that the inaugural flight of its reusable Space Rider vehicle is expected in 2028. Space Rider is an eight-metre-long reusable spacecraft designed to carry technology demonstration and scientific payloads into orbit for up to two months before returning them to Earth. The spacecraft employs a steerable parafoil to enable […]
The post Inaugural Space Rider Flight to Occur in 2028 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: BlackSky confirms it was the ‘confidential customer’ on recent Rocket Lab Electron rocket launch
summary: The Earth imaging company released a statement on Tuesday stating that its latest Gen-3 satellite launched successfully and began sending high-quality images within 24 hours.

title: ESA DG Says NASA Confirms Commitment to ExoMars Rover
summary: ESA Director General Josef Aschbacher announced today that NASA has confirmed it will help get the ExoMars Rosalind Franklin rover to Mars. Developed in partnership with Roscosmos, ESA terminated all […]

title: ESA on ‘good track’ to secure funding despite notes of caution
summary:
ESA wrapped up the first day of a critical ministerial conference sounding upbeat about progress in securing funding for the next three years, despite a few warning signs.
The post ESA on ‘good track’ to secure funding despite notes of caution appeared first on SpaceNews.
